00019 
00020 /**
00021  * Specify the US location.
00022  */
00023 define('S3_LOCATION_US', 'us');
00024 
00025 /**
00026  * Specify the European Union (EU) location.
00027  */
00028 define('S3_LOCATION_EU', 'eu');
00029 
00030 /**
00031  * ACL: Owner-only read/write.
00032  */
00033 define('S3_ACL_PRIVATE', 'private');
00034 
00035 /**
00036  * ACL: Owner read/write, public read.
00037  */
00038 define('S3_ACL_PUBLIC', 'public-read');
00039 
00040 /**
00041  * ACL: Public read/write.
00042  */
00043 define('S3_ACL_OPEN', 'public-read-write');
00044 
00045 /**
00046  * ACL: Owner read/write, authenticated read.
00047  */
00048 define('S3_ACL_AUTH_READ', 'authenticated-read');
00049 
00050 /**
00051  * PCRE: Match all items
00052  */
00053 define('S3_PCRE_ALL', '/.*/i');
00054

00056 /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00057 // MAIN CLASS
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * Container for all Amazon S3-related methods.
00061  * 
00062  * @example s3/__construct
00063  */
00064 class AmazonS3 extends TarzanCore
00065 {
00066         /**
00067          * @var The request URL.
00068          */
00069         var $request_url;
00070 
00071         /**
00072          * @var The virtual host setting.
00073          */
00074         var $vhost;
00075 
00076 
00077         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00078         // CONSTRUCTOR
00079 
00080         /**
00081          * Constructor
00082          * 
00083          * @access public
00084          * @param string $key Your Amazon API Key. If blank, it will look for the AWS_KEY constant.
00085          * @param string $secret_key Your Amazon API Secret Key. If blank, it will look for the AWS_SECRET_KEY constant.
00086          * @return bool FALSE if no valid values are set, otherwise true.
00087          * @example s3/__construct
00088          */
00089         public function __construct($key = null, $secret_key = null)
00090         {
00091                 $this->vhost = null;
00092                 $this->api_version = '2006-03-01';
00093                 parent::__construct($key, $secret_key);
00094         }
00095 
00096 
00097         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00098         // AUTHENTICATION
00099 
00100         /**
00101          * Authenticate
00102          *
00103          * Authenticates a connection to S3.
00104          *
00105          * @access public
00106          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00107          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters for authenticating. See the individual methods for allowed keys.
00108          * @param string $location (Do Not Use) Used internally by this function on occasions when S3 returns a redirect code and it needs to call itself recursively.
00109          * @param integer $redirects (Do Not Use) Used internally by this function on occasions when S3 returns a redirect code and it needs to call itself recursively.
00110          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00111          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTAuthentication.html
00112          */
00113         public function authenticate($bucket, $opt = null, $location = null, $redirects = 0)
00114         {
00115                 // If nothing was passed in, don't do anything.
00116                 if (!$opt)
00117                 {
00118                         return false;
00119                 }
00120                 else
00121                 {
00122                         // Set default values
00123                         $bucket = strtolower($bucket);
00124                         $acl = null;
00125                         $body = null;
00126                         $contentType = null;
00127                         $delimiter = null;
00128                         $filename = null;
00129                         $marker = null;
00130                         $maxKeys = null;
00131                         $method = null;
00132                         $prefix = null;
00133                         $verb = null;
00134                         $lastmodified = null;
00135                         $etag = null;
00136                         $qsa = null;
00137                         $md5 = null;
00138                         $meta = null;
00139                         $hmeta = null;
00140                         $range = null;
00141                         $returnCurlHandle = null;
00142 
00143                         // Break the array into individual variables, while storing the original.
00144                         $_opt = $opt;
00145                         extract($opt);
00146 
00147                         $filename = rawurlencode($filename);
00148 
00149                         // Set hostname
00150                         if ($this->vhost)
00151                         {
00152                                 $hostname = $this->vhost;
00153                         }
00154                         elseif ($method == 'list_buckets')
00155                         {
00156                                 $hostname = 's3.amazonaws.com';
00157                         }
00158                         else
00159                         {
00160                                 $hostname = $bucket . '.s3.amazonaws.com';
00161                         }
00162 
00163                         // Get the UTC timestamp in RFC 2616 format
00164                         $since_epoch = time() + $this->adjust_offset;
00165                         $httpDate = gmdate(DATE_AWS_RFC2616, $since_epoch);
00166 
00167                         // Generate the request string
00168                         $request = '';
00169 
00170                         // Append additional parameters
00171                         $request .= '/' . $filename;
00172 
00173                         // List Object settings
00174                         if ($method == 'list_objects')
00175                         {
00176                                 if (isset($prefix) && !empty($prefix))
00177                                 {
00178                                         $request = '/?prefix=' . $prefix;
00179                                 }
00180                                 else if (isset($marker) && !empty($marker))
00181                                 {
00182                                         $request = '/?marker=' . $marker;
00183                                 }
00184                                 else if (isset($maxKeys) && !empty($maxKeys))
00185                                 {
00186                                         $request = '/?max-keys=' . $maxKeys;
00187                                 }
00188                                 else if (isset($delimiter) && !empty($delimiter))
00189                                 {
00190                                         $request = '/?delimiter=' . $delimiter;
00191                                 }
00192                         }
00193 
00194                         // Logging
00195                         elseif ($method == 'get_logs')
00196                         {
00197                                 $request .= '?logging';
00198                                 $filename .= '?logging';
00199                         }
00200 
00201                         // Get Bucket Locale settings
00202                         elseif ($method == 'get_bucket_locale')
00203                         {
00204                                 $request = '/?location';
00205                                 $filename = '?location';
00206                         }
00207 
00208                         // Add ACL stuff if we're getting/setting ACL preferences.
00209                         elseif ($method == 'get_bucket_acl' || $method == 'get_object_acl')
00210                         {
00211                                 $request .= '?acl';
00212                                 $filename .= '?acl';
00213                         }
00214 
00215                         if (!$request == '/')
00216                         {
00217                                 $request = '/' . $request;
00218                         }
00219 
00220                         // Prepare the request.
00221                         if ($location)
00222                         {
00223                                 $this->request_url = $location;
00224                         }
00225                         else
00226                         {
00227                                 $this->request_url = 'http://' . $hostname . $request;
00228                         }
00229 
00230                         // Instantiate the request class
00231                         $req = new $this->request_class($this->request_url);
00232 
00233                         // Do we have a verb?
00234                         if (isset($verb) && !empty($verb))
00235                         {
00236                                 $req->setMethod($verb);
00237                         }
00238 
00239                         // Do we have a contentType?
00240                         if (isset($contentType) && !empty($contentType))
00241                         {
00242                                 $req->addHeader('Content-Type', $contentType);
00243                         }
00244                         else if ($verb == HTTP_PUT) // Set a default value for HTTP_PUT
00245                         {
00246                                 $contentType = 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded';
00247                         }
00248 
00249                         // Do we have a date?
00250                         if (isset($httpDate) && !empty($httpDate))
00251                         {
00252                                 $req->addHeader("Date", $httpDate);
00253                         }
00254 
00255                         // Do we have ACL settings? (Optional in signed string)
00256                         if (isset($acl) && !empty($acl))
00257                         {
00258                                 $req->addHeader("x-amz-acl", $acl);
00259                                 $acl = 'x-amz-acl:' . $acl . "\n";
00260                         }
00261 
00262                         // Do we have COPY settings?
00263                         if ($method == 'copy_object')
00264                         {
00265                                 $acl .= 'x-amz-copy-source:/' . $sourceBucket . '/' . $sourceObject . "\n";
00266                                 $req->addHeader('x-amz-copy-source', '/' . $sourceBucket . '/' . $sourceObject);
00267                         }
00268 
00269                         // Are we checking for changes?
00270                         if ($lastmodified && $etag)
00271                         {
00272                                 $req->addHeader('If-Modified-Since', $lastmodified);
00273                                 $req->addHeader('If-None-Match', $etag);
00274                         }
00275 
00276                         // Partial content range
00277                         if ($range)
00278                         {
00279                                 $req->addHeader('Range', 'bytes=' . $range);
00280                         }
00281 
00282                         // Add a body if we're creating
00283                         if ($method == 'create_object' || $method == 'create_bucket')
00284                         {
00285                                 if (isset($body) && !empty($body))
00286                                 {
00287                                         $req->setBody($body);
00288                                         $md5 = $this->util->hex_to_base64(md5($body));
00289                                         $req->addHeader('Content-MD5', $md5);
00290                                 }
00291 
00292                                 // Add any meta headers.
00293                                 if ($meta)
00294                                 {
00295                                         uksort($meta, 'strnatcasecmp');
00296 
00297                                         foreach ($meta as $k => $v)
00298                                         {
00299                                                 $req->addHeader('x-amz-meta-' . strtolower($k), $v);
00300                                                 $hmeta .= 'x-amz-meta-' . strtolower($k) . ':' . $v . "\n";
00301                                         }
00302                                 }
00303                         }
00304 
00305                         // Data that will be "signed".
00306                         $filename = '/' . $filename;
00307 
00308                         // If we're listing buckets, there is no filename value.
00309                         if ($method == 'list_buckets')
00310                         {
00311                                 $filename = '';
00312                         }
00313 
00314                         if ($qsa)
00315                         {
00316                                 // Prepare the string to sign
00317                                 $stringToSign = "$verb\n$md5\n$contentType\n$since_epoch\n$acl$hmeta/$bucket$filename";
00318                         }
00319                         else
00320                         {
00321                                 // Prepare the string to sign
00322                                 $stringToSign = "$verb\n$md5\n$contentType\n$httpDate\n$acl$hmeta/$bucket$filename";
00323                         }
00324 
00325                         // Hash the AWS secret key and generate a signature for the request.
00326                         $signature = $this->util->hex_to_base64(hash_hmac('sha1', $stringToSign, $this->secret_key));
00327 
00328                         // Pass the developer key and signature
00329                         $req->addHeader("Authorization", "AWS " . $this->key . ":" . $signature);
00330 
00331                         // If we have a "true" value for returnCurlHandle, do that instead of completing the request.
00332                         if ($returnCurlHandle)
00333                         {
00334                                 return $req->prepRequest();
00335                         }
00336 
00337                         // Are we getting a Query String Auth?
00338                         if ($qsa)
00339                         {
00340                                 return array(
00341                                         'bucket' => $bucket,
00342                                         'filename' => $filename,
00343                                         'key' => $this->key,
00344                                         'expires' => $since_epoch,
00345                                         'signature' => $signature,
00346                                 );
00347                         }
00348 
00349                         // Send!
00350                         $req->sendRequest();
00351 
00352                         // Prepare the response.
00353                         $headers = $req->getResponseHeader();
00354                         $headers['x-tarzan-redirects'] = $redirects;
00355                         $headers['x-tarzan-requesturl'] = $this->request_url;
00356                         $headers['x-tarzan-stringtosign'] = $stringToSign;
00357                         $headers['x-tarzan-requestheaders'] = $req->request_headers;
00358                         $data = new $this->response_class($headers, $req->getResponseBody(), $req->getResponseCode());
00359 
00360                         // Did Amazon tell us to redirect? Typically happens for multiple rapid requests EU datacenters.
00361                         // @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/Redirects.html
00362                         if ((int) $req->getResponseCode() == 307) // Temporary redirect to new endpoint.
00363                         {
00364                                 $redirects++;
00365                                 $data = $this->authenticate($bucket, 
00366                                         $_opt, 
00367                                         $headers['location'], 
00368                                         $redirects);
00369                         }
00370 
00371                         // Return!
00372                         return $data;
00373                 }
00374         }
00375 
00376         /**
00377          * Set Virtual Host
00378          * 
00379          * Use this virtual host instead of the normal bucket.s3.amazonaws.com domain.
00380          * 
00381          * @access public
00382          * @param string $vhost (Required) The hostname to use instead of bucket.s3.amazonaws.com.
00383          * @return void
00384          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?VirtualHosting.html
00385          * @example s3/set_vhost
00386          */
00387         public function set_vhost($vhost)
00388         {
00389                 $this->vhost = $vhost;
00390         }

00393         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00394         // BUCKET METHODS
00395 
00396         /**
00397          * Create Bucket
00398          *
00399          * The bucket holds all of your objects, and provides a globally unique namespace in which you 
00400          * can manage the keys that identify objects. A bucket can hold any number of objects.
00401          *
00402          * @access public
00403          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to create.
00404          * @param string $locale (Optional) Sets the preferred geographical location for the bucket. Accepts S3_LOCATION_US or S3_LOCATION_EU. Defaults to S3_LOCATION_US.
00405          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00406          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00407          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTBucketPUT.html
00408          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/UsingBucket.html
00409          * @example s3/create_bucket
00410          */
00411         public function create_bucket($bucket, $locale = null, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00412         {
00413                 // Defaults
00414                 $body = null;
00415                 $contentType = null;
00416 
00417                 if ($locale)
00418                 {
00419                         switch(strtolower($locale))
00420                         {
00421                                 case 'eu':
00422                                         $body = '<CreateBucketConfiguration><LocationConstraint>' . strtoupper($locale) . '</LocationConstraint></CreateBucketConfiguration>';
00423                                         $contentType = 'application/xml';
00424                                         break;
00425                         }
00426                 }
00427 
00428                 // Authenticate to S3
00429                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, array(
00430                         'verb' => HTTP_PUT,
00431                         'method' => 'create_bucket',
00432                         'body' => $body,
00433                         'contentType' => $contentType,
00434                         'returnCurlHandle' => $returnCurlHandle
00435                 ));
00436         }
00437 
00438         /**
00439          * Get Bucket
00440          *
00441          * Referred to as "GET Bucket" in the AWS docs, but implemented here as AmazonS3::list_objects().
00442          * 
00443          * @access public
00444          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00445          * @see list_objects
00446          */
00447         public function get_bucket($bucket, $opt = null)
00448         {
00449                 return $this->list_objects($bucket, $opt);
00450         }
00451 
00452         /**
00453          * Get Bucket Locale
00454          *
00455          * Lists the location constraint of the bucket. U.S.-based buckets have no response.
00456          *
00457          * @access public
00458          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00459          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00460          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00461          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTBucketLocationGET.html
00462          * @example s3/get_bucket_locale
00463          */
00464         public function get_bucket_locale($bucket, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00465         {
00466                 // Add this to our request
00467                 $opt = array();
00468                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00469                 $opt['method'] = 'get_bucket_locale';
00470                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00471 
00472                 // Authenticate to S3
00473                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00474         }
00475 
00476         /**
00477          * HEAD Bucket
00478          * 
00479          * Reads only the HTTP headers of an object within a bucket.
00480          *
00481          * @access public
00482          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00483          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00484          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00485          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectHEAD.html
00486          * @example s3/head_bucket
00487          */
00488         public function head_bucket($bucket, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00489         {
00490                 // Add this to our request
00491                 $opt = array();
00492                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_HEAD;
00493                 $opt['method'] = 'head_bucket';
00494                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00495 
00496                 // Authenticate to S3
00497                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00498         }
00499 
00500         /**
00501          * If Bucket Exists
00502          * 
00503          * Checks whether this bucket already exists in your account or not.
00504          * 
00505          * @access public
00506          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00507          * @return boolean Whether it exists or not.
00508          * @example s3/if_bucket_exists
00509          */
00510         public function if_bucket_exists($bucket)
00511         {
00512                 $header = $this->head_bucket($bucket);
00513                 return $header->isOK();
00514         }
00515 
00516         /**
00517          * Delete Bucket
00518          *
00519          * All objects in the bucket must be deleted before the bucket itself can be deleted.
00520          *
00521          * @access public
00522          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to delete.
00523          * @param boolean $force (Optional) Whether to force-delete the bucket and all of its contents. Defaults to false.
00524          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00525          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse|boolean Standard TarzanHTTPResponse if normal bucket deletion or if forced bucket deletion was successful, a boolean false if the forced deletion was unsuccessful.
00526          * @section example Example Code:
00527          * @include s3/delete_bucket
00528          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTBucketDELETE.html
00529          */
00530         public function delete_bucket($bucket, $force = false, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00531         {
00532                 // Set default value
00533                 $success = true;
00534 
00535                 if ($force)
00536                 {
00537                         // Delete all of the items from the bucket.
00538                         $success = $this->delete_all_objects($bucket);
00539                 }
00540 
00541                 // As long as we were successful...
00542                 if ($success)
00543                 {
00544                         // Add this to our request
00545                         $opt = array();
00546                         $opt['verb'] = HTTP_DELETE;
00547                         $opt['method'] = 'delete_bucket';
00548                         $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00549 
00550                         // Authenticate to S3
00551                         return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00552                 }
00553 
00554                 return false;
00555         }
00556 
00557         /**
00558          * Copy Bucket
00559          * 
00560          * Copies the contents of a bucket into a new bucket.
00561          * 
00562          * @access public
00563          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the source bucket.
00564          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the destination bucket.
00565          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00566          */
00567         public function copy_bucket($source_bucket, $dest_bucket)
00568         {
00569                 $dest = $this->create_bucket($dest_bucket);
00570 
00571                 if ($dest->isOK())
00572                 {
00573                         $list = $this->get_object_list($source_bucket);
00574                         $handles = array();
00575         
00576                         foreach ($list as $item)
00577                         {
00578                                 $handles[] = $this->copy_object($source_bucket, $item, $dest_bucket, $item, array(
00579                                         'acl' => S3_ACL_PRIVATE, 
00580                                         'returnCurlHandle' => true
00581                                 ));
00582                         }
00583 
00584                         $request = new $this->request_class(null);
00585                         return $request->sendMultiRequest($handles);
00586                 }
00587         }
00588 
00589         /**
00590          * Rename Bucket
00591          * 
00592          * Renames a bucket by making a copy and deleting the original.
00593          * 
00594          * @access public
00595          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the source bucket.
00596          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the destination bucket.
00597          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00598          */
00599         public function rename_bucket($source_bucket, $dest_bucket)
00600         {
00601                 $responses = array();
00602                 $responses['copy'] = $this->copy_bucket($source_bucket, $dest_bucket);
00603                 $responses['delete'] = $this->delete_bucket($source_bucket, true);
00604 
00605                 return $responses;
00606         }
00607 
00608         /**
00609          * Get Bucket Size
00610          * 
00611          * Gets the number of files in the bucket.
00612          * 
00613          * @access public
00614          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00615          * @return integer The number of files in the bucket.
00616          */
00617         public function get_bucket_size($bucket)
00618         {
00619                 return count($this->get_object_list($bucket));
00620         }
00621 
00622         /**
00623          * Get Bucket File Size
00624          * 
00625          * Gets the file size of the contents of the bucket.
00626          * 
00627          * @access public
00628          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to check.
00629          * @param boolean $friendly_format (Optional) Whether to format the value to 2 decimal points using the largest possible unit (i.e. 3.42 GB).
00630          * @return integer|string The number of bytes as an integer, or the friendly format as a string.
00631          */
00632         public function get_bucket_filesize($bucket, $friendly_format = false)
00633         {
00634                 $filesize = 0;
00635                 $list = $this->list_objects($bucket);
00636 
00637                 foreach ($list->body->Contents as $filename)
00638                 {
00639                         $filesize += (int) $filename->Size;
00640                 }
00641 
00642                 if ($friendly_format)
00643                 {
00644                         $filesize = $this->util->size_readable($filesize);
00645                 }
00646 
00647                 return $filesize;
00648         }

00650         /**
00651          * List Buckets
00652          * 
00653          * Gets a list of all of the buckets on the S3 account.
00654          * 
00655          * @access public
00656          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00657          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00658          */
00659         public function list_buckets($returnCurlHandle = null)
00660         {
00661                 // Add this to our request
00662                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00663                 $opt['method'] = 'list_buckets';
00664                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00665 
00666                 // Authenticate to S3
00667                 return $this->authenticate('', $opt);
00668         }
00669 
00670         /**
00671          * Get Bucket List
00672          * 
00673          * ONLY lists the bucket names on the S3 account.
00674          * 
00675          * @access public
00676          * @param string $pcre (Optional) A Perl-Compatible Regular Expression (PCRE) to filter the bucket names against.
00677          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00678          */
00679         public function get_bucket_list($pcre = null)
00680         {
00681                 // Set some default values
00682                 $bucketnames = array();
00683 
00684                 // Get a list of buckets.
00685                 $list = $this->list_buckets();
00686 
00687                 // If we have a PCRE regex, store it.
00688                 if ($pcre)
00689                 {
00690                         // Loop through and find the bucket names.
00691                         foreach ($list->body->Buckets->Bucket as $bucket)
00692                         {
00693                                 $bucket = (string) $bucket->Name;
00694 
00695                                 if (preg_match($pcre, $bucket))
00696                                 {
00697                                         $bucketnames[] = $bucket;
00698                                 }
00699                         }
00700                 }
00701                 else
00702                 {
00703                         // Loop through and find the bucket names.
00704                         foreach ($list->body->Buckets->Bucket as $bucket)
00705                         {
00706                                 $bucketnames[] = (string) $bucket->Name;
00707                         }
00708                 }
00709 
00710                 return (count($bucketnames) > 0) ? $bucketnames : null;
00711         }
00712 
00713         /**
00714          * Get Bucket ACL
00715          * 
00716          * Gets the ACL settings for a bucket.
00717          * 
00718          * @access public
00719          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00720          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00721          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00722          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTAccessPolicy.html
00723          */
00724         public function get_bucket_acl($bucket, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00725         {
00726                 // Add this to our request
00727                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00728                 $opt['method'] = 'get_bucket_acl';
00729                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00730 
00731                 // Authenticate to S3
00732                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00733         }

00736          * Set Bucket ACL
00737          * 
00738          * Sets the ACL settings for a bucket.
00739          * 
00740          * @access public

00742          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00743          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00744          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTAccessPolicy.html
00745          */

00747         {

00750                 $opt['method'] = 'set_bucket_acl';

00762         /**
00763          * Create Object
00764          *
00765          * Once you have a bucket, you can start storing objects in it. Objects are stored using the HTTP 
00766          * PUT method. Each object can hold up to 5 GB of data. When you store an object, S3 streams the 
00767          * data to multiple storage servers in multiple data centers to ensure that the data remains 
00768          * available in the event of internal network or hardware failure.
00769          *
00770          * @access public
00771          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00772          * @param array $opt (Required) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00773          * <ul>
00774          *   <li>string filename - (Required) The filename for the content.</li>
00775          *   <li>string body - (Required) The data to be stored in the object.</li>
00776          *   <li>string contentType - (Required) The type of content that is being sent in the body.</li>
00777          *   <li>string acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.</li>
00778          *   <li>boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
00779          *   <li>array meta - (Optional) Associative array of key-value pairs. Represented by x-amz-meta-: Any header starting with this prefix is considered user metadata. It will be stored with the object and returned when you retrieve the object. The total size of the HTTP request, not including the body, must be less than 4 KB.</li>
00780          * </ul>
00781          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00782          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectPUT.html
00783          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTAccessPolicy.html
00784          */
00785         public function create_object($bucket, $opt = null)
00786         {
00787                 // Add this to our request
00788                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_PUT;
00789                 $opt['method'] = 'create_object';
00790                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($opt['filename']);
00791 
00792                 // Authenticate to S3
00793                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00794         }
00795 
00796         /**
00797          * Get Object
00798          * 
00799          * Reads the contents of an object within a bucket.
00800          *
00801          * @access public
00802          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00803          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
00804          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00805          * <ul>
00806          *   <li>string lastmodified - (Optional) The LastModified header passed in from a previous request. If used, requires 'etag' as well. Will return a 304 if file hasn't changed.</li>
00807          *   <li>string etag - (Optional) The ETag header passed in from a previous request. If used, requires 'lastmodified' as well. Will return a 304 if file hasn't changed.</li>
00808          *   <li>boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
00809          *   <li>string $range - (Optional) A range of bytes to fetch from the file. Useful for downloading partial bits or completing incomplete files. Range notated with a hyphen (e.g. 0-10485759). Defaults to the complete file.
00810          * </ul>
00811          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00812          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectGET.html
00813          */
00814         public function get_object($bucket, $filename, $opt = null)
00815         {
00816                 // Add this to our request
00817                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00818                 $opt['method'] = 'get_object';
00819                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($filename);
00820 
00821                 // Authenticate to S3
00822                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00823         }
00824 
00825         /**
00826          * HEAD Object
00827          * 
00828          * Reads only the HTTP headers of an object within a bucket.
00829          *
00830          * @access public
00831          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket check.
00832          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
00833          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00834          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00835          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectHEAD.html
00836          */
00837         public function head_object($bucket, $filename, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00838         {
00839                 // Add this to our request
00840                 $opt = array();
00841                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_HEAD;
00842                 $opt['method'] = 'head_object';
00843                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($filename);
00844                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00845 
00846                 // Authenticate to S3
00847                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00848         }
00849 
00850         /**
00851          * If Object Exists
00852          * 
00853          * Checks whether this object already exists in this bucket.
00854          * 
00855          * @access public
00856          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket check.
00857          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
00858          * @return boolean Whether it exists or not.
00859          */
00860         public function if_object_exists($bucket, $filename)
00861         {
00862                 $header = $this->head_object($bucket, $filename);
00863                 return $header->isOK();
00864         }
00865 
00866         /**
00867          * Delete Object
00868          * 
00869          * Deletes an object within a bucket.
00870          *
00871          * @access public
00872          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00873          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename you want to delete.
00874          * @param boolean $returnCurlHandle (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.
00875          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse Standard TarzanHTTPResponse.
00876          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/RESTObjectDELETE.html
00877          */
00878         public function delete_object($bucket, $filename, $returnCurlHandle = null)
00879         {
00880                 // Add this to our request
00881                 $opt = array();
00882                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_DELETE;
00883                 $opt['method'] = 'delete_object';
00884                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($filename);
00885                 $opt['returnCurlHandle'] = $returnCurlHandle;
00886 
00887                 // Authenticate to S3
00888                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00889         }
00890 
00891         /**
00892          * Delete All Objects
00893          * 
00894          * Delete all of the objects inside the specified bucket.
00895          *
00896          * @access public
00897          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00898          * @param string $pcre (Optional) PCRE regular expression to match filenames by. Defaults to S3_PCRE_ALL.
00899          * @return boolean Determines the success of deleting all files.
00900          * @see delete_object
00901          */
00902         public function delete_all_objects($bucket, $pcre = S3_PCRE_ALL)
00903         {
00904                 // Collect all matches
00905                 $list = $this->get_object_list($bucket, array('pcre', $pcre));
00906 
00907                 // As long as we have at least one match...
00908                 if (count($list) > 0)
00909                 {
00910                         // Hold CURL handles
00911                         $handles = array();
00912 
00913                         // Go through all of the items and delete them.
00914                         foreach ($list as $item)
00915                         {
00916                                 $handles[] = $this->delete_object($bucket, $item, true);
00917                         }
00918 
00919                         $request = new $this->request_class(null);
00920                         return $request->sendMultiRequest($handles);
00921                 }
00922 
00923                 return false;
00924         }
00925 
00926         /**
00927          * List Objects
00928          * 
00929          * Lists the objects in a bucket. Provided as the 'GetBucket' action in Amazon's REST API.
00930          *
00931          * @access public
00932          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00933          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00934          * <ul>
00935          *   <li>string prefix - (Optional) Restricts the response to only contain results that begin with the specified prefix.</li>
00936          *   <li>string marker - (Optional) It restricts the response to only contain results that occur alphabetically after the value of marker.</li>
00937          *   <li>string maxKeys - (Optional) Limits the number of results returned in response to your query. Will return no more than this number of results, but possibly less.</li>
00938          *   <li>string delimiter - (Optional) Unicode string parameter. Keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter will be rolled up into a single result element in the CommonPrefixes collection.</li>
00939          *   <li>boolean $returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
00940          * </ul>
00941          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00942          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/gsg/ListKeys.html
00943          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/ListingKeysRequest.html
00944          */
00945         public function list_objects($bucket, $opt = null)
00946         {
00947                 // Add this to our request
00948                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
00949                 $opt['method'] = 'list_objects';
00950 
00951                 // Authenticate to S3
00952                 return $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
00953         }
00954 
00955         /**
00956          * Get Object File Size
00957          * 
00958          * Gets the file size of the object.
00959          * 
00960          * @access public
00961          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket check.
00962          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
00963          * @param boolean $friendly_format (Optional) Whether to format the value to 2 decimal points using the largest possible unit (i.e. 3.42 GB).
00964          * @return integer|string The number of bytes as an integer, or the friendly format as a string.
00965          */
00966         public function get_object_filesize($bucket, $filename, $friendly_format = false)
00967         {
00968                 $object = $this->head_object($bucket, $filename);
00969                 $filesize = (integer) $object->header['content-length'];
00970 
00971                 if ($friendly_format)
00972                 {
00973                         $filesize = $this->util->size_readable($filesize);
00974                 }
00975 
00976                 return $filesize;
00977         }
00978 
00979         /**
00980          * Get Object List
00981          * 
00982          * ONLY lists the object filenames from a bucket.
00983          *
00984          * @access public
00985          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used.
00986          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00987          * <ul>
00988          *   <li>string prefix - (Optional) Restricts the response to only contain results that begin with the specified prefix.</li>
00989          *   <li>string marker - (Optional) It restricts the response to only contain results that occur alphabetically after the value of marker.</li>
00990          *   <li>string maxKeys - (Optional) Limits the number of results returned in response to your query. Will return no more than this number of results, but possibly less.</li>
00991          *   <li>string delimiter - (Optional) Unicode string parameter. Keys that contain the same string between the prefix and the first occurrence of the delimiter will be rolled up into a single result element in the CommonPrefixes collection.</li>
00992          *   <li>string pcre - (Optional) A Perl-Compatible Regular Expression (PCRE) to filter the filenames against. This is applied AFTER any native S3 filtering from 'prefix', 'marker', 'maxKeys', or 'delimiter'.</li>
00993          * </ul>
00994          * @return array
00995          * @see list_objects
00996          */
00997         public function get_object_list($bucket, $opt = null)
00998         {
00999                 // Set some default values
01000                 $filenames = array();
01001                 $pcre = null;
01002 
01003                 // Get a list of files.
01004                 $list = $this->list_objects($bucket, $opt);
01005 
01006                 // Extract the options
01007                 if ($opt)
01008                 {
01009                         extract($opt);
01010                 }
01011 
01012                 // If we have a PCRE regex, store it.
01013                 if ($pcre)
01014                 {
01015                         // Loop through and find the filenames.
01016                         foreach ($list->body->Contents as $file)
01017                         {
01018                                 $file = (string) $file->Key;
01019 
01020                                 if (preg_match($pcre, $file))
01021                                 {
01022                                         $filenames[] = $file;
01023                                 }
01024                         }
01025                 }
01026                 else
01027                 {
01028                         // Loop through and find the filenames.
01029                         foreach ($list->body->Contents as $file)
01030                         {
01031                                 $filenames[] = (string) $file->Key;
01032                         }
01033                 }
01034 
01035                 return (count($filenames) > 0) ? $filenames : null;
01036         }
01037 
01038         /**
01039          * Copy Object
01040          * 
01041          * Copies an object to a new location.
01042          * 
01043          * @access public
01044          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the source file.
01045          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01046          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that you want to copy the file to.
01047          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01048          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
01049          * <ul>
01050          *   <li>string acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.</li>
01051          *   <li>boolean returnCurlHandle - (Optional) A private toggle that will return the CURL handle for the request rather than actually completing the request. This is useful for MultiCURL requests.</li>
01052          *   <li>array meta - (Optional) Associative array of key-value pairs. Represented by x-amz-meta-: Any header starting with this prefix is considered user metadata. It will be stored with the object and returned when you retrieve the object. The total size of the HTTP request, not including the body, must be less than 4 KB.</li>
01053          * </ul>
01054          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTObjectCOPY.html
01055          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?UsingCopyingObjects.html
01056          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?RESTObjectPUT.html#RESTObjectPUTRequestHeaders
01057          */
01058         public function copy_object($source_bucket, $source_filename, $dest_bucket, $dest_filename, $opt = null)
01059         {
01060                 // Add this to our request
01061                 $opt['verb'] = HTTP_PUT;
01062                 $opt['method'] = 'copy_object';
01063                 $opt['sourceBucket'] = $source_bucket;
01064                 $opt['sourceObject'] = $source_filename;
01065                 $opt['destinationBucket'] = $dest_bucket;
01066                 $opt['destinationObject'] = $dest_filename;
01067                 $opt['filename'] = rawurlencode($dest_filename);
01068                 $opt['metadataDirective'] = 'COPY';
01069 
01070                 // Do we have metadata?
01071                 if (isset($opt['meta']) && is_array($opt['meta']))
01072                 {
01073                         $opt['metadataDirective'] = 'REPLACE';
01074                 }
01075 
01076                 // Authenticate to S3
01077                 return $this->authenticate($dest_bucket, $opt);
01078         }
01079 
01080         /**
01081          * Duplicate Object
01082          * 
01083          * Identical to copy_object(), except that it only copies within a single bucket.
01084          * 
01085          * @access public
01086          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the file.
01087          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01088          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01089          * @param string $acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.
01090          */
01091         public function duplicate_object($bucket, $source_filename, $dest_filename, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE)
01092         {
01093                 return $this->copy_object($bucket, $source_filename, $bucket, $dest_filename, array('acl' => $acl));
01094         }
01095 
01096         /**
01097          * Move Object
01098          * 
01099          * Moves an object to a new location.
01100          * 
01101          * @access public
01102          * @param string $source_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the source file.
01103          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01104          * @param string $dest_bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that you want to copy the file to.
01105          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01106          * @param string $acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.
01107          */
01108         public function move_object($source_bucket, $source_filename, $dest_bucket, $dest_filename, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE)
01109         {
01110                 $copy = $this->copy_object($source_bucket, $source_filename, $dest_bucket, $dest_filename, array('acl' => $acl));
01111                 $del = $this->delete_object($source_bucket, $source_filename);
01112                 return $copy;
01113         }
01114 
01115         /**
01116          * Rename Object
01117          * 
01118          * Identical to move_object(), except that it only moves within a single bucket.
01119          * 
01120          * @access public
01121          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that contains the file.
01122          * @param string $source_filename (Required) The source filename that you want to copy.
01123          * @param string $dest_filename (Required) The filename that you want to give to the copy.
01124          * @param string $acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PRIVATE.
01125          */
01126         public function rename_object($bucket, $source_filename, $dest_filename, $acl = S3_ACL_PRIVATE)
01127         {
01128                 return $this->move_object($bucket, $source_filename, $bucket, $dest_filename, $acl);
01129         }

01216         /**
01217          * Set Logging Permissions
01218          * 
01219          * Determine the permissions for managing the logging process.
01220          * 
01221          * @todo Implement this method.
01222          */
01223         public function set_logging_permissions()
01224         {
01225                 
01226         }
01227

01229         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
01230         // MISCELLANEOUS METHODS
01231 
01232         /**
01233          * Store Remote File
01234          * 
01235          * Takes an existing remote file, stores it to S3, and returns a URL.
01236          * 
01237          * @access public
01238          * @param string $remote_file (Required) The full URL of the file to store on the S3 service.
01239          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket that you want to store it in.
01240          * @param string $filename (Required) The name that you want to give to the file.
01241          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
01242          * <ul>
01243          *   <li>string acl - (Optional) One of the following options: S3_ACL_PRIVATE, S3_ACL_PUBLIC, S3_ACL_OPEN, or S3_ACL_AUTH_READ. Defaults to S3_ACL_PUBLIC.</li>
01244          *   <li>string overwrite - (Optional) If set to true, checks to see if the file exists and will overwrite the old data with new data. Defaults to false.</li>
01245          * </ul>
01246          * @return string The S3 URL for the uploaded file. Returns null if unsuccessful.
01247          */
01248         public function store_remote_file($remote_file, $bucket, $filename, $opt = null)
01249         {
01250                 // Set default values.
01251                 $acl = S3_ACL_PUBLIC;
01252                 $overwrite = false;
01253                 $cname = null;
01254 
01255                 if ($opt)
01256                 {
01257                         // Break the options out.
01258                         extract($opt);
01259                 }
01260 
01261                 // Does the file already exist?
01262                 $object = $this->head_object($bucket, $filename);
01263 
01264                 // As long as it doesn't already exist, fetch and store it.
01265                 if (!$object->isOK() || $overwrite)
01266                 {
01267                         // Fetch the file
01268                         $file = new $this->request_class($remote_file);
01269                         $file->sendRequest();
01270 
01271                         // Store it in S3
01272                         unset($object);
01273                         $object = $this->create_object($bucket, array(
01274                                 'filename' => $filename,
01275                                 'body' => $file->getResponseBody(),
01276                                 'contentType' => $file->getResponseHeader('content-type'),
01277                                 'acl' => $acl
01278                         ));
01279                 }
01280 
01281                 // Was the request successful?
01282                 if ($object->isOK())
01283                 {
01284                         $url = $object->header['x-tarzan-requesturl'];
01285 
01286                         // If we have a virtual host value, use that instead of Amazon's hostname. There are better ways of doing this, but it works for now.
01287                         if ($this->vhost)
01288                         {
01289                                 $url = str_ireplace('http://', '', $url);
01290                                 $url = explode('/', $url);
01291                                 $url[0] = $this->vhost;
01292                                 $url = 'http://' . implode('/', $url);
01293                         }
01294 
01295                         return $url;
01296                 }
01297                 else
01298                 {
01299                         return null;
01300                 }
01301         }
01302 
01303         /**
01304          * Get Object URL
01305          * 
01306          * Gets the URL for the file.
01307          * 
01308          * @access public
01309          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used. Pass null if using AmazonS3::set_vhost().
01310          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
01311          * @param integer $qsa (Required) This doubles as a boolean (do you want to use Query String Authentication?) and an integer (how many seconds from now should this authentication work?). Defaults to 0/false.
01312          * @return string The file URL, with authentication parameters if requested.
01313          */
01314         public function get_object_url($bucket, $filename, $qsa = 0)
01315         {
01316                 if ($qsa)
01317                 {
01318                         // Add this to our request
01319                         $opt['verb'] = HTTP_GET;
01320                         $opt['method'] = 'get_object_url';
01321                         $opt['filename'] = $filename;
01322                         $opt['qsa'] = $qsa;
01323 
01324                         // Adjust the clock
01325                         $old_offset = $this->adjust_offset;
01326                         $this->adjust_offset($qsa);
01327 
01328                         // Authenticate to S3
01329                         $data = $this->authenticate($bucket, $opt);
01330 
01331                         // Reset the clock
01332                         $this->adjust_offset = $old_offset;
01333 
01334                         if ($this->vhost)
01335                         {
01336                                 return 'http://' . $this->vhost . $data['filename'] . '?AWSAccessKeyId=' . $data['key'] . '&Expires=' . $data['expires'] . '&Signature=' . rawurlencode($data['signature']);
01337                         }
01338                         
01339                         return 'http://' . $data['bucket'] . '.s3.amazonaws.com' . $data['filename'] . '?AWSAccessKeyId=' . $data['key'] . '&Expires=' . $data['expires'] . '&Signature=' . rawurlencode($data['signature']);
01340                 }
01341                 else
01342                 {
01343                         // If we're using a virtual host, use that instead.
01344                         if ($this->vhost)
01345                         {
01346                                 return 'http://' . $this->vhost . '/' . $filename;
01347                         }
01348 
01349                         return 'http://' . $bucket . '.s3.amazonaws.com/' . $filename;
01350                 }
01351         }
01352 
01353         /**
01354          * Get Torrent URL
01355          * 
01356          * Gets the URL for the torrent file for the file.
01357          * 
01358          * @access public
01359          * @param string $bucket (Required) The name of the bucket to be used. Pass null if using AmazonS3::set_vhost().
01360          * @param string $filename (Required) The filename for the content.
01361          * @return string The Torrent URL.
01362          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AmazonS3/2006-03-01/index.html?S3Torrent.html
01363          */
01364         public function get_torrent_url($bucket, $filename)
01365         {
01366                 // If we're using a virtual host, use that instead.
01367                 if ($this->vhost)
01368                 {
01369                         return 'http://' . $this->vhost . '/' . $filename . '?torrent';
01370                 }
01371                 return 'http://' . $bucket . '.s3.amazonaws.com/' . $filename . '?torrent';
01372         }
01373 }
